meanings.definition: A breed of hunting dog bred for their ability to track and chase foxes.
meanings.sent1: The foxhounds eagerly followed the scent of the fox through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The pack of foxhounds set off on the hunt early in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fox played a game of hide-and-seek with the foxhounds.
meanings.sent4: The foxhounds were like determined detectives on the trail of their elusive suspect.
meanings.sent5: The image of the swift foxhounds racing through the fields stayed etched in his mind.

meanings.definition: A group of foxhounds used for hunting.
meanings.sent1: The master hunter led his foxhounds into the dense woods to track down the fox.
meanings.sent2: The foxhounds barked excitedly as they cornered the cunning fox in the brush.
meanings.sent3: The foxhounds celebrated their successful hunt with wagging tails and joyful barks.
meanings.sent4: The pack of foxhounds moved as one, a synchronized force of nature in pursuit of their prey.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the foxhounds' howls echoed through the valley, signaling the end of the chase.
